block.p: In the volatile world of presidential election campaigns and half-day news cycles, the ups and downs of traffic to candidates' Web sites can be particularly volatile. From January to February, Barack Obama overtook Hillary Clinton for the lead in Web visitors, as they had their first big skirmish over remarks by David Geffen, a supporter of Mr. Obama's.
Joe Biden had to answer for his own remarks about Mr. Obama, and John McCain pre-announced his candidacy on David Letterman's show.
